DIA_Gerd_HELLO_03_02: The usual. Work is going on.
DIA_Gerd_Work_03_02: I'm mainly responsible for molding the grinders and making sure there are no gaps or crevices in them.
DIA_Gerd_Work_03_03: This way we can be sure that the wood we burn is of the highest quality.
DIA_Gerd_Who_03_02: If you're asking who pays me, that person is our foreman, Helmud. He's the one in charge of the work at the camp.
DIA_Gerd_Who_03_03: We've been busy lately. We've been getting a lot of orders from the Wolf's Den.
DIA_Gerd_Who_03_04: But I'm not complaining. At least it's good money.
DIA_Gerd_Wolf_03_02: That's what they call this old mountain stronghold across the lake.
DIA_Gerd_Wolf_03_03: It is said to be in the possession of a certain Ulryk, a vassal of the governor, but other than that, I know nothing about it.
DIA_Gerd_Wolf_03_04: His men sometimes come to supervise our work. They are armored from head to toe and carry these big axes.
DIA_Gerd_Wolf_03_05: I'd stay out of their way if I were you.
DIA_Gerd_Nirko_15_01: Do you know a guy named Elco?
DIA_Gerd_Nirko_03_02: I'm sorry, but I don't know anyone with that name.
DIA_Gerd_Nirko_03_03: To be honest, I'm new here and just learning the trade.
DIA_Gerd_Nirko_15_04: And have you ever seen a guy with short hair, a beard and a mole on his cheek?
DIA_Gerd_Nirko_03_06: Now if you'll excuse me, I'm busy. I don't want Helmud to see me slacking off.
DIA_Gerd_Ambient_03_02: I hope that soon Helmud will appreciate my work. I've made twice as much as others lately!
DIA_Gerd_Ambient_15_03: You must really like what you do.
DIA_Gerd_Ambient_03_04: I'm telling you, you should try this job sometime, buddy.
DIA_Gerd_Ambient_03_06: These beasts are coming more and more often under the charcoal pile.
DIA_Gerd_Ambient_03_09: I can still handle them, but not everyone here knows how to swing a sword.
DIA_Gerd_Ambient_03_10: Someone should do something about them.
DIA_Gerd_Ambient_03_11: Do you hear that? That's what peace and quiet sounds like.
DIA_Gerd_Ambient_03_12: Since getting rid of the snappers, my only problem is picking a time to take a break from work.
